content: Taxes, after all, are dues that we pay for the privileges of membership in an organized society. ~Franklin D. Roosevelt All governments require taxes in order to provide the services the its people need. The taxes should be allocated among the people in a fair manner and based upon the ability to pay. The "flat tax" and the VAT are allocated unfairly among the people. They are based generally upon the expenditures of the individual and are unrelated to the individual's ability to pay. Consequently, the poor would pay a greater percentage of their incomes in this form of taxes than would the wealthy. The fairest form of taxation is the progressive income tax. It levies a greater amount and percentage from the wealthy than it does from the poorer individual -- and that is the way it should be. Let's never fall into the trap of the politician's dream tax -- the flat tax or the VAT or a national sales tax, whatever it is called!

content: Taxes, after all, are dues that we pay for the privileges of membership in an organized society. ~Franklin D. Roosevelt All governments require taxes in order to provide the services the its people need. The taxes should be allocated among the people in a fair manner and based upon the ability to pay. The "flat tax" and the VAT are allocated unfairly among the people. They are based generally upon the expenditures of the individual and are unrelated to the individual's ability to pay. Consequently, the poor would pay a greater percentage of their incomes in this form of taxes than would the wealthy. The fairest form of taxation is the progressive income tax. It levies a greater amount and percentage from the wealthy than it does from the poorer individual -- and that is the way it should be. Let's never fall into the trap of the politician's dream tax -- the flat tax or the VAT or a national sales tax, whatever it is called!
